DataElement.preferredName: Blood Oxygen Level Dependent Arterial Spin Labeling Oxygen Sat Percentage Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The percentag value of Oxyhaemoglobin in an individual undergoing BOLD-ASL imaging; deoxyhaemoglobin can serve as an intrinsic paramagnetic contrast agent in a brain MRI. [Manually-curated]

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Blood Oxygen Level Dependent Imaging Arterial Spin Labeling Blood Oxygen
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A magnetic resonance imaging technique that uses the difference between the magnetic signals of hemoglobin when it is carrying oxygen (oxyhemoglobin) and when it is not carrying oxygen (deoxyhemoglobin) to detect metabolic activity, and hence neurologic activity, in the brain._A blood vessel that carries blood away from the heart._All written, printed, or graphic matter accompanying an article at any time while such article is in interstate commerce or held for sale after shipment or delivery in interstate commerce._Blood circulating throughout the body._An element with atomic symbol O, atomic number 8, and atomic weight 16.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Blood Oxygen Level Dependant Imaging Artery Labeling
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Utilizes Magnetic Resonance Imaging and the fact that hemoglobin gives off a different magnetic signal when it is carrying oxygen (oxyhemoglobin) compared to when it is not carrying oxygen (deoxyhemoglobin). (from http://www.musc.edu/fnrd/function.htm):The vessels carrying blood away from the heart.:All written, printed, or graphic matter accompanying an article at any time while such article is in interstate commerce or held for sale after shipment or delivery in interstate commerce.

Concepts.definition: A magnetic resonance imaging technique that uses the difference between the magnetic signals of hemoglobin when it is carrying oxygen (oxyhemoglobin) and when it is not carrying oxygen (deoxyhemoglobin) to detect metabolic activity, and hence neurologic activity, in the brain.
A blood vessel that carries blood away from the heart.
All written, printed, or graphic matter accompanying an article at any time while such article is in interstate commerce or held for sale after shipment or delivery in interstate commerce.

Property.preferredDefinition: Blood circulating throughout the body.:use this term only for elemental or gaseous oxygen (02); for other compounds see OXYGEN COMPOUND.

Concepts.definition: A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood.
An element with atomic symbol O, atomic number 8, and atomic weight 16.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The percentage value of oxygen-hemoglobin saturation of blood either by withdrawing a sample and passing it through a classical photoelectric oximeter or by electrodes attached to some translucent part of the body like finger, earlobe, or skin fold; includes non-invasive oxygen monitoring by pulse oximetry.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated to support MGH adoption of C3D
